    • Method Detail

      • encode

        public static byte[] encode(byte[] bytes)
        Encode byte sequence into another byte sequence according to Base 64 encoding (RFC 1521, RFC 1421). Each byte is either lating character, digit, plus, slash, equals sign, line break ("\n") or cariage return ("\r") character in ASCII encoding. Despite of specification, this function dosn't insert line breaks if output line is longer than 76 characters. You should use encodeIntoMultipleLines for that
        Parameters:
        bytes -
        Returns:
        encoded bytestream

      • encodeIntoMultipleLines

        public static byte[] encodeIntoMultipleLines(byte[] bytes)
        Encode byte sequence into another byte sequence according to Base 64 encoding (RFC 1521, RFC 1421). Each byte is either lating character, digit, plus, slash, equals sign, line break ("\n") or cariage return ("\r") character in ASCII encoding. Output is automatically broken int multiple lines if it is too long. This method is the same as encodeIntoMultipleLines(bytes, standardLineLength) Where standardLineLength is maximum line length allowed by MIME standard (RFC 1521), currently 76.
        Parameters:
        bytes -
        Returns:
        encoded bytestream

      • encodeIntoMultipleLines

        public static byte[] encodeIntoMultipleLines(byte[] bytes,
                             int splitLinesAt)
        Encode byte sequence into another byte sequence according to Base 64 encoding (RFC 1521, RFC 1421). Each byte is either lating character, digit, plus, slash, equals sign, line break ("\n") or cariage return ("\r") character in ASCII encoding. Output is automatically broken int multiple lines if it is too long.
        Parameters:
        bytes -
        splitLinesAt - maximal length of lines in output
        Returns:
        encoded bytestream

      • encode

        public static String encode(String s,
            Charset charset)
        Encode string into another string according to Base 64 encoding (RFC 1521, RFC 1421). Despite of specification, this function dosn't insert line breaks if output line is longer than 76 characters. You should use encodeIntoMultipleLines for that
        Parameters:
        s - string to encode
        charset - string encoding to decode input string into sequence opf bytes
        Returns:
        encoded string of lating characters, digits, plus, slash, equals signs, line breaks ("\n") or cariage returns ("\r")

      • encodeIntoMultipleLines

        public static String encodeIntoMultipleLines(String s,
                             Charset charset)
        Encode string into another string according to Base 64 encoding (RFC 1521, RFC 1421). Output is automatically broken int multiple lines if it is too long. Maximum line length is that allowed by MIME standard (RFC 1521), currently 76.
        Parameters:
        s - string to encode
        charset - string encoding to decode input string into sequence opf bytes
        Returns:
        encoded string of lating characters, digits, plus, slash, equals signs, line breaks ("\n") or cariage returns ("\r")

      • encodeIntoMultipleLines

        public static String encodeIntoMultipleLines(String s,
                             String encoding)
                                      throws UnsupportedEncodingException
        Encode string into another string according to Base 64 encoding (RFC 1521, RFC 1421). Output is automatically broken int multiple lines if it is too long. Maximum line length is that allowed by MIME standard (RFC 1521), currently 76.
        Parameters:
        s - string to encode
        encoding - string encoding to decode input string into sequence opf bytes
        Returns:
        encoded string of lating characters, digits, plus, slash, equals signs, line breaks ("\n") or cariage returns ("\r")
        Throws:
        UnsupportedEncodingException

      • createOneLineEncoderOutputStream

        public static OutputStream createOneLineEncoderOutputStream(OutputStream encoded)
        Create new OutputStream based on one passed as argument. When bytes are written into resulting output stream they are first converted into Base64 encoding (RFC 1521, RFC 1421) and then written into ouput stream passed as argument. Only lating characters, digits, plus, slash, equals signs, line breaks ("\n") or cariage returns ("\r") in ASCII encoding are written into argument output stream that way. Despite of specification, this function dosn't insert line breaks if output line is longer than 76 characters, you should use createEncoderOutputStream for that.
        Parameters:
        encoded - output stream to write base64 encoded data into
        Returns:
        output stream that encodes data into base64 and writes encoded data into output stream passed as argument

      • createEncoderOutputStream

        public static OutputStream createEncoderOutputStream(OutputStream encoded)
        Create new OutputStream based on one passed as argument. When bytes are written into resulting output stream they are first converted into Base64 encoding (RFC 1521, RFC 1421) and then written into ouput stream passed as argument. Only lating characters, digits, plus, slash, equals signs, line breaks ("\n") or cariage returns ("\r") in ASCII encoding are written into argument output stream that way. Output is automatically broken int multiple lines if it is too long. Maximum line length is that allowed by MIME standard (RFC 1521), currently 76.
        Parameters:
        encoded - output stream to write base64 encoded data into
        Returns:
        output stream that encodes data into base64 and writes encoded data into output stream passed as argument

      • createEncoderOutputStream

        public static OutputStream createEncoderOutputStream(OutputStream encoded,
                                     int splitLinesAt)
        Create new OutputStream based on one passed as argument. When bytes are written into resulting output stream they are first converted into Base64 encoding (RFC 1521, RFC 1421) and then written into ouput stream passed as argument. Only lating characters, digits, plus, slash, equals signs, line breaks ("\n") or cariage returns ("\r") in ASCII encoding are written into argument output stream that way. Output is automatically broken int multiple lines if it is too long.
        Parameters:
        encoded - output stream to write base64 encoded data into
        splitLinesAt - maximal line length of output lines
        Returns:
        output stream that encodes data into base64 and writes encoded data into output stream passed as argument
